article.title: Privacy Preserving Stream Analytics: The Marriage of Randomized Response and Approximate Computing

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements about the system architecture in Figure 1 is **incorrect**?
choices: Users\' private data is stored locally on their devices.
Analysts publish streaming queries to the system.
Clients send their query answers directly to the analysts.
The aggregator aggregates received answers from the clients.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the XOR-based encryption scheme shown in Figure 2, what is the purpose of the message identifier (MID)?
choices: To encrypt the client\'s randomized answer.
To identify the client who sent the message.
To allow the aggregator to join ME and MKi messages.
To provide differential privacy for the client.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 4(a) shows the accuracy loss with varying sampling and randomization parameters. Which of the following statements is **true** based on this figure?
choices: Increasing the sampling fraction always improves accuracy regardless of p and q values.
Increasing the second randomization parameter (q) always results in lower accuracy loss.
The accuracy loss is independent of the sampling fraction.
The values of p and q have no effect on the accuracy loss.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 5(c) illustrates the use of stratified sampling. What is the main benefit of employing stratified sampling over simple random sampling in PRIVAPPROX?
choices: To reduce the computational overhead at the clients.
To improve the anonymity of the clients.
To ensure proportional data selection from different strata (sub-streams).
To reduce the communication overhead between proxies and the aggregator.
